text: it's a simple act making a cup of tea
but for corporal Andrew Garthwaite it's
a feat of remarkable Bionic engineering
the soldier from South Tyneside has one
of the most advanced Bionic arms in the
world and he's controlling it with his
mind because obviously I haven't had a
thumb or a finger for the last three
years and all of a sudden I start
feeling stuff it's just a total weird
feelings he got trainee brain to
actually realize to move this hand and
with the long sleeve it doesn't look as
if you've got a prosthetic arm until it
starts making the motor noises itself
three years ago
corporal Garthwaite was struck by a
rocket-propelled grenade while fighting
the Taliban in Afghanistan from the
right hand side I heard a bang but then
within a split second it was I was on
the floor my arm was on fire and I stood
up and I was totally our god and the
arms fell off and it was a big shock so
I actually fell back on the ground again
I was lifted up and after about ten
minutes that was from getting hit - a
helicopter coming in and getting took to
come past him I made it back and I'm
alive so I owe my life to these guys his
life saved
corporal Garthwaite would go on to make
medical history in becoming the first
person from the UK to have this Bionic
technology so how does it work corporal
cath weights arm was blown off at the
shoulder surgeons rewired the nerve
endings that would have run down to his
hand into his chest then an electronic
connection would link his chest muscles
with his Bionic prosthesis what this
means is that we take all the nerves
that have originally went to his arm and
reroute them into muscles of his chest
so that eventually then when he thinks
of moving his hand moving his arm moving
his fingers the different muscles on his
chest wall will then start to fire part
of the most of that they've put it in
actually hand feels as if it's on my
chest so now when I tuck my left hand
side of my chest he thought I might have
the right hand side it's been actually a
little finger so now when I think about
opening my hand which is I do I think
about doing that on this side and
actually
opens the hand and I can still do the
party trick of it gone a full 360 if you
wanted to it's also good one for the
kids parties
